title: HSBC annual pre-tax profit drops over 7%, revenue jumps as bank's results top estimates
summary: HSBC, Europe's largest lender, reported annual pre-tax profit of $29.91 billion on Wednesday, beating estimates despite a 7% profit decline. Revenue growth offset profit drops, signaling resilience in the banking sector.
content: Europe's largest lender HSBC on Wednesday reported annual pre-tax profit of $29.91 billion, beating the bank's estimates.

title: These are the ‘secret words’ Trump wants to hear as U.S., Iran prepare to meet this week
summary: U.S. and Iranian negotiators are set to meet later this week as President Trump outlined specific demands for Tehran in his State of the Union address. The meeting will test diplomatic channels amid ongoing tensions.
content: U.S. and Iranian negotiators are set to meet again later this week, and President Donald Trump made a clear ask of Tehran in his State of the Union speech on Tuesday night ahead of those talks.

title: Trump backs stock-trade ban for Congress during State of the Union. Here’s where the effort stands.
summary: President Trump called for Congress to ban insider trading among lawmakers in his State of the Union address, receiving bipartisan applause. The effort aims to restrict securities trading by members of Congress.
content: President Donald Trump got applause from Democrats and Republicans alike when he called in his State of the Union address for Congress to stop insider trading among lawmakers.

title: Elusive Shein boss hails Chinese roots in rare public appearance
summary: Shein's CEO made a rare public appearance acknowledging his Chinese roots despite the company's efforts to distance itself from China by relocating to Singapore. The statement marks a notable shift in the company's public positioning.
content: His speech follows years of the firm focusing away from China as it moved its headquarters to Singapore.

title: The global M&A boom is rolling into 2026 as AI sparks deal frenzy — but cash is getting tight
summary: The global M&A market is expected to continue its 2026 surge driven by AI-related deal activity, though funding tightness poses challenges. Wall Street has regained appetite for large-scale transactions despite constrained cash availability.
content: Markets are betting that the global M&A surge has not yet finished, as Wall Street recovered its appetite for large-scale financings.

title: Trump says Iran wants a deal more than the U.S. as American forces build up in oil-rich Middle East
summary: President Trump claims Iran is more eager for a nuclear deal than the United States as American military forces build up in the Middle East. The two countries are set to begin a third round of bilateral negotiations in Switzerland this week.
content: Iran wants to make a "deal" more than the U.S., President Donald Trump said Tuesday, ahead of a third round of bilateral talks in Switzerland later this week.

title: U.S. Supreme Court tariff ruling will likely allow India to keep buying Russian oil
summary: A Supreme Court tariff ruling is likely to permit India to continue purchasing Russian oil without facing U.S. sanctions. Analysts suggest the U.S. lacks sufficient leverage to force India to eliminate its Russian energy imports.
content: India is unlikely to eliminate Russian oil imports and the U.S. may not have enough leverage to push New Delhi to do so, analysts say.

title: Nvidia, Microsoft back self-driving firm Wayve as it hits $8.6 billion valuation
summary: Autonomous vehicle startup Wayve reached an $8.6 billion valuation after securing $1.2 billion in Series D funding led by Eclipse, Balderton, and SoftBank Vision Fund 2. Nvidia and Microsoft were among the major tech companies backing the round.
content: The $1.2 billion Series D round was led by Eclipse, Balderton and SoftBank Vision Fund 2

title: Wednesday's big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
summary: Software stocks recovered from recent selling pressure on Tuesday, pushing major market indexes higher. The sector rebound provided significant momentum to overall market gains.
content: Software stocks bounced after the latest bout of selling, lifting the major averages to a winning session Tuesday.

title: Cava says diners are doing better this year — and may be getting tired of chasing meal deals
summary: Mediterranean fast-casual restaurant Cava issued an optimistic sales forecast for 2026 as customer traffic rebounded from weather disruptions and effects of last year's government shutdown. The company suggests consumers are moving away from discount-chasing behavior.
content: Cava issued an upbeat sales forecast for this year, as cautious customers shook off the effects of snowstorms and last year’s government shutdown to return to the Mediterranean fast-casual chain for bowls and salads.

title: Could Stripe ‘salvage’ PayPal? What Wall Street has to say about the latest takeover talk.
summary: PayPal has underinvested in its consumer business, an analyst says. But Stripe could still find value in it.
content: PayPal has underinvested in its consumer business, an analyst says. But Stripe could still find value in it.

title: What is the UK's new travel system and how are dual nationals affected?
summary: From 25 February, a new system will come into force which will affect many people, including British dual nationals.
content: From 25 February, a new system will come into force which will affect many people, including British dual nationals.

title: Energy bills to fall in April after charges shake-up
summary: Changes announced in the Budget mean domestic energy prices should fall sharply in April.
content: Changes announced in the Budget mean domestic energy prices should fall sharply in April.

title: Paramount boosts Warner Bros offer to rival Netflix in takeover bid
summary: Warner Bros says the latest proposal could convince it to abandon the deal it struck with Netflix.
content: Warner Bros says the latest proposal could convince it to abandon the deal it struck with Netflix.
